name: Wheeloffortune
body:
# Wheel Of Fortune AI

## Introduction

The best way of measuring progress of a machine is by looking back over previous iterations. As you push to place more data into a machine, it makes the machine better fit to compete against a human opponent. By using this, I can compare the progress the machine's brain is making, and cause it to make better decisions versus an opponent.

## Description

This project runs the game "Wheel of Fortune" for a human to play against. It has the ability to pit other AI against itself as well. By making each iteration just a bit better than the last, I can compare the abilities of each machine stage. 

I've found a few helpful databases online to give the machines a list of words to choose from. These will in turn help the database choose a phrase to match in the spaces given. Depending on how well the sentence fits, the second iteration and beyond will be able to make an educated guess on what it might be.

The project is setup through 4 iterations, with each iteration being a bit smarter than the last.

1. A basic “Spin to win” approach (including a dictionary)
2. “Spin to win” plus a database of commonly used words
3. Add a database of common phrases, and use those phrases to guess
4. Implement a best letter choice that will use shannon entropy

When the project is finished, you should be able to choose what opponents you want to play against, and possibly how many of each. 

I am hoping that in the end, the fourth iteration will be almost impossible to beat.

# Teaser

This shows how the GUI works with the machine. 
![Board](http://i.imgur.com/TGeDAKD.png)
As you choose letters, they are no longer accessible to any other players.
![Keyboard](http://i.imgur.com/lUxHDOx.png)
Adding a sleep timer makes the game more realistic to the human player, and also makes it easier for them to observe the others.
